0.Pros: it was not very hard work
0.Cons: it did not pay very much

1.Cons: Food is not free for employees

2.Pros: Free Crew Meal, Good Pay, Meet New People
2.Cons: Stress, Schedule was sometimes not suitable to my life

3.Cons: Doesn't really care about employees. My availability starts at 4 pm every day, they have me scheduled to start at 3 pm every day. I need to be home at a certain time each night, they have me working overtime every night.

4.Summary: "Terrible place to work other than the people that I worked with"
4.Pros: I enjoyed working with the people that I worked with, we were like a family.
4.Cons: - Stressful job- Not enough pay- Get screwed over by scheduling

5.Pros: Customers always keep you on your toesassistant managers are supportive
5.Cons: In seedy neighborhoods customers will try and pass off counterfeit moneyManagers call you in on your off days frequently

6.Cons: Difficult people in terms of customer service

7.Pros: Made own schedules and managers worked with you during school year
7.Cons: Some employees (crew) felt in charge but were not

9.Summary: "It is a good starter job for anyone."
9.Pros: Build customer service skills, money handling skills, and working efficiently.
9.Cons: The customers can be very rude at times and management is always pushing for faster times over accuracy.
